reviews.text: luis was so amazing and such a fun, genuine server! loved the service.
Gio fue un excelente mesero me encant√≥ la comida aqu√≠ recomiendo mucho que vengan !!
Muy buen ambiente; atendidos muy bien por Guio, la comida rica, la m√∫sica buen√≠sima, pasamos un rato s√∫per grato.
We had a great time with my friend! Thank you Luis for your service. We will be back again.
Luis was fantastic!! Excellent service and very friendly!
Amazing experience! Great ambiance, service, and food! Luis, our waiter, was fantastic!
It‚Äôs always pleasure eating at Mission Ceviche UES. The food, service and atmosphere is always exceptional! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Luis was fantastic and took care of us - especially when the kitchen was a little backed up. Food was excellent
We LOVE this place and visit every time we are in NYC!
One of the best ceviches i‚Äôve ever had in the United States, and excellent service. Multiple visits.
Gracias por todo chicos
Daya made our dinner so memorable. She was a great addition to our night
amazing food and ambiance! Daya was great!
Daya was amazing! Excellent service and food and vibes. Will definitely be back !
Daya was the best server! Great food and great experience
Amazing dinner! Daya was the best!
Tutto altro che un buon ristorante peruviano, √® un peccato ci era stato raccomandato ma spero vivamente in New York ci sia di meglio!

Absolutely loved this restaurant! The food was beyond amazing. every bite full of flavor and so beautifully done. The atmosphere was elegant but still cozy, and the service made the whole night even better. Truly one of those places you can‚Äôt wait to go back to
Excellent service with even better food. Perfect for groups, tasty cocktails.
Gio nos atendi√≥ espectacular! Muy buena la comida, todo!

Amazing food and service by Luis and Gio. Luis was attentive and explained all our meals to us. He checked in to make sure we were all good and was really pleasant and friendly. He made our experience better than we expected. We had a wonderful time.
Luis was a great waiter!
The desserts were a highlight.

Amazing pisco sour shoutout to Eduardo! (I have had pisco sours at all of the Peruvian restaurants in NYC and as a half Peruvian I can confidently state this is the best). -
Service was top notch - Luis was great! Lunch time is perfectly quiet but the service is amazing. Also, ceviche portions are solid.

10/10 recommend
Amazing
Todo estuvo super bueno, totalmente recomenda
Excellent food, service, and ambience.

Sunday dinner turned into a fantastic surprise!  We chose Peruvian food.  What we found was a beautiful blend of Japanese and Chinese inspired blends with traditional Peruvian flavors that were both unexpected and amazing.  Our service was great from the moment we walked in the door.  Daya took great care of us.  And if you are pondering dessert, you must try the sweet corn brulee!  Put this place on your list if you have been there yet.
Great food and service
Love the atmosphere and food! Is always a great idea to visit for a quick lunch or for dinner with friends.
The food was delicious and Daya was such a wonderful server. We had a great time!

The restaurant have 2 locations.
We have visited both.
100% recommend
One of the best restaurants in NY. Everyone should try this place. Amazing amazing amazing. So so good
Great food, service was very good as well. Definitely looking forward to coming back.
great food and very friendly service, everything is delicious

Tuvimos la oportunidad de visitar Mission  Ceviche y podemos decir que todo estuvo al 100, buen servicio y la comida deliciosa. Daya nos atendi√≥ y nos sentimos muy agusto. En general el personal muy amable. Lo recomendamos totalmente.

Jorge & Rub√©n üáªüá™üá≤üáΩ

I had the lunch prix fixe menu and it's a relatively good deal. The seared salmon was really good, but my friend's ceviche tasted even better. The ceviche is fresh and flavorful and not over saturated with lime. The bronzino dish had really good sauce.

The dessert might have been the highlight. The mousse was very good. My friend said he would have bought a bucket of it to take home if he could. There's layers of soft and hard with the mousse and the ice and layers of sweet and salty and a little bit of tart from the berries. The desert was complex and multi faceted. Amazing end to the meal
Great service from Daya!
Daya and Anderson were fantastic! Food was great!
Espectacular la comida y sus anfitriones al volver a NY Volvere Siempre
Daya was a great waitress, she was so kind and gave us great service.
Come here for every NY visit, never disappoints
We loved our experience here. Excelent food and service, thanks to Luis and Frankie for their suggestions, we'll come back soon!

El mejor restaurante peruano de NY y por mucha.. La comida brutal! Y la atenci√≥n de la mejor que he recibido! Luis y Frank nos ayudaron a obtener la mejor experiencia posible con sus recomendaciones y actitud. De todas maneras regreso y lo recomiendo!
Luis really helped us navigate this menu to pick out some incredible dishes. Everything was excellent!
Diana and Ciorma thank you so much for your time and making this day even more special for us, we did appreciate a lot your attention.

We had an amazing meal here as always.  I made a mistake and only made the reservation for two, when we were three, and of course they accommodated us. The flavors are just incredible and so different. I dream about the octopus appetizer. Our server, Daya, was knowledgeable, super friendly, and attentive. Though tempted to gatekeep, can‚Äôt recommend enough!!!
Wonderful dinner! Ceviche is amazing. Luis and Diana were great. Awesome service and very funny!

Prob√© el ceviche peruano y el maki anticuchero, y ambos fueron una verdadera explosi√≥n de sabor. El ceviche estaba perfectamente equilibrado: el pescado fresco, el toque justo de lim√≥n y ese picante suave que resalta sin opacar los dem√°s sabores. Se notaba la frescura y la autenticidad de la preparaci√≥n, muy al estilo tradicional peruano.

El maki anticuchero fue una grata sorpresa una fusi√≥n creativa entre la cocina japonesa y peruana con una salsa anticuchera intensa y deliciosa, que combinaba de forma perfecta con el arroz y el relleno. Una mezcla √∫nica que demuestra el talento del chef.

El servicio fue amable y atento, el ambiente acogedor y con ese toque peruano que hace que uno se sienta como en casa. Sin duda, un lugar que recomendar√≠a y al que volver√≠a sin pensarlo.

Daya was the BEST server ever even after I slapped my water and spilt it everywhere. The ambiance is fun and not too loud. I got the branzino with a Maracuja sour and both were out of this world delicious. The service was perfect and not too overbearing, very sweet staff here. 11/10 would come again

I had such an incredible dining experience at Mission Ceviche! The food here is next-level ‚Äî beautifully presented and absolutely bursting with flavor.

I ordered the ceviche, and it was to die for. Fresh, vibrant, and perfectly balanced ‚Äî easily one of the best I‚Äôve ever had. The ‚Äútrust latches‚Äù (the crispy fried bites served alongside) were equally amazing, a must-try combination. Every dish was plated with such care and creativity, making it not just a meal but an experience.

The atmosphere is warm, modern, and stylish ‚Äî perfect for enjoying authentic Peruvian cuisine with a contemporary touch. On top of that, the service was outstanding. Our waiter, Louis, went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience. He was so attentive, helpful, and genuinely welcoming, which made the meal even more enjoyable.

If you‚Äôre in the area, I highly recommend stopping by Mission Ceviche. Whether you‚Äôre a fan of Peruvian food or trying it for the first time, this place will absolutely impress you. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

Festive Peruvian restaurant with good food, nice ambiance and friendly service. Tried this place for the first time, just 3 weeks after returning from Cusco, Peru. We had the Ceviche Classico, the grilled branzino, the braised short rib and the crispy Brussel sprouts. They were all very tasty. 4.5/5 compared to the food we had in Cusco. Highly recommend this restaurant for the Peruvian cuisine and lively atmosphere.

The restaurant itself is undeniably beautiful, with a warm ambiance and attentive service. Unfortunately, that is where the positives end. I left the meal deeply disappointed, to the point where I cannot see myself returning.
The ceviche was confusing in execution, served with a mix of icy cold seafood and fried shrimp. We specifically ordered the version with crab, but what arrived was a nearly microscopic claw with no real meat, hidden under a mound of corn. The guacamole, though theatrically prepared tableside, tasted no different from a standard preparation, and was paired with a couple of tostones that seemed more microwaved than freshly made.
By this point, we were more surprised than upset, though that changed with the Lomo Saltado. At $48, this dish felt like the greatest letdown of the night: the meat arrived well-done, despite our request for medium-rare, and the only redeeming element was the rice on the side‚Äîwhich says a lot.
When offered dessert, we declined. The bill was already unreasonably high for what I can honestly say was some of the poorest quality food I‚Äôve had in New York City.

Wow! Truly blown away by my visit here. It‚Äôs been on my list for so long and did not disappoint! The ceviche sampler was a wonderful way to try multiple dishes. Each one was more flavorful than the next. The short rib & risotto were also delicious and portioned perfectly to share. They also made a point to acknowledge the birthday note on the reservation and provided a sparkler! Over all 10/10 experience. Do yourself a favor and make yourself a reservation. You won‚Äôt regret it!

We visited this restaurant to try Peruvian cuisine, and it met our expectations. The sushi-like starters and the salads we tried were incredibly tasty ‚Äî we didn‚Äôt even get the chance to take photos before they were gone! :)
The seafood rice dish, similar to paella, was actually even more flavorful than any paella we‚Äôve had before. Also, the passion fruit cocktail recommended by our waiter was absolutely worth trying!

First time here! Great location. The place was clean and inviting. The food presentation was beautiful. Most of the food we tried was delicious but the stand outs for me were the Red snapper chicharron, shrimp risotto, loved the lima roll and the guacamole and the tostones.
Great selection of cocktails also. Service was a little slow when we were there, but staff are accommodating. I just need to keep asking for the chips! All in all had a positive experience.

It‚Äôs been on my bucket list for quite some time now and finally made it. I always find Peruvian cuisine to be fascinating,  blend of indigenous, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, African and European influences. All the dishes we ordered were well seasoned and balanced, vibrant, tasty and interesting. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

¬°Simplemente excepcional! Cada vez que vengo aqu√≠ tengo tanto orgullo amor y pasi√≥n por esta comida! Amo todo! El chef Jos√© Luis Ch√°vez, creador de Mission Ceviche aqu√≠ en Nueva York, es un genio de la cocina peruana moderna! Incre√≠ble! Cada plato es una obra de arte: exquisito, equilibrado y lleno de sabor. Se nota su pasi√≥n, su t√©cnica y su alma en cada bocado. ¬°Todo es espectacular!
Adem√°s, tengo el honor de llamarlo amigo ‚Äîy me hace feliz ver c√≥mo sigue conquistando paladares con su autenticidad y creatividad.
Si est√°s en NYC, Mission Ceviche es una parada obligada!! Felicidades y m√°s √©xitos!

Mission Ceviche en la 2da Avenida es de esos lugares que no se visitan‚Ä¶ se viven. Desde que entras, todo vibra distinto: la energ√≠a, los aromas, la m√∫sica, la atenci√≥n ‚Äîtodo tiene alma.

El ceviche no solo est√° fresco, est√° vivo. Cada bocado tiene ese golpe c√≠trico que te despierta los sentidos y te recuerda por qu√© la cocina peruana es un arte. El pulpo, los c√≥cteles, los detalles‚Ä¶ todo est√° pensado para que te quedes un rato m√°s, y a√∫n as√≠ quieras volver.

Hay restaurantes que sirven comida.
Y hay otros, como este, que te dejan una historia.

Mission Ceviche ‚Äîun lugar que simplemente no puedes dejar de conocer en Nueva York

Came here with a few friends who were visiting to celebrate their birthday and I gotta say, service was above and beyond amazing! Drinks were excellent and food was pretty good! One of my fav Peruvian places in the city.

One of the best Peruvian restaurants in the city! I‚Äôve been coming here for years and it‚Äôs still my favorite. The pulpo ceviche and the ceviche nikkei are always incredible and a MUST. Also, delicious oysters! Mission Ceviche is always on my list of recommendations for anyone visiting NYC!
Huge shoutout to our server Luis, he‚Äôs so friendly, attentive, and truly made the experience even better. Thank you Luis!!

We had a wonderful dinner. Our waitress Destiny provided an outstanding service and was always on top of our wishes, friendly and nice. Food and drinks  arrived very promptly. We absolutely loved all the ceviche dishes, the broccolini side dish was amazing as well. A special thanks to the dessert chef: the tres leches cake was absolutely divine: very moist, lots of flavor, super delectable. The general manager Christian has a very special touch for treating guests with respect and warm attention. I highly recommend this restaurant for a nice meal and friendly service.
I wish I was hungrier when I arrived because the food here was amazing. Our server, Daya, was so kind and made our experience even better. Would 100% recommend a friend coming up to the area

I went to a Peruvian restaurant for the first time and while waiting for the food they brought something like roasted corn kernels, it was so tasty and addictive! I ordered a chicken Caesar salad and it was incredibly delicious. The chicken was so tender it melted in my mouth and the dressing was amazing. Definitely a place I‚Äôd go back to!

A favorite we go to weekly ! Jaz at the bar is incredible! She makes the best old fashioned I've ever had ! The food is also amazing - get the octopus, anticuchero, lomo saltado, it's all really amazing. Next stop: Sub-Mission üòè IYKYK‚Ä¶

The food was amazing & the drinks were strong. A tad expensive, but definitely worth the price. If you like Peruvian food, this is a great spot. For a date night, I‚Äôd say it was top-tier. The waiters were a vibe and so was the restaurant.

Mission Ceviche offers a vibrant and refined take on Peruvian cuisine in the heart of Manhattan‚Äôs Upper East Side. Their three-course lunch prix fixe menu at $45 is an excellent value given the exceptional quality and execution. The classic ceviche is impeccably fresh, with perfectly balanced citrus, spice, and seasoning that highlight the fish‚Äôs natural flavor. The pan-seared salmon, served with a light tomato salad, is cooked to perfection‚Äîdelicate, flavorful, and well-composed. For dessert, the fresh berries with white chocolate mousse provide a clean and elegant finish to a well-paced meal. The restaurant blends innovation and charm with outstanding consistency. Highly recommended for both casual lunches and special outings.

Amazing dining experience. The causa and octopus were exceptionally good!!!! The only plate I would probably not order again is the flamed steak rolls but that‚Äôs just because I prefer seafood and everything that we tried here was outstanding!

Mathi was our server he and the rest of the teams was very attentive to our dining needs. The service food and atmosphere was great‚Ä¶ my friends and I loved every dish that landed on the table we too many to actually remember .

I came here for my birthday dinner, and it was such a lovely experience! Although the food took a little while to come out, it was absolutely worth the wait‚Äîeverything was delicious, which is what truly matters. The service was excellent, with friendly and attentive staff who made the evening even better. What made it even more special was that the main chef and owner of the restaurant was there personally modifying dishes, adding a unique and thoughtful touch to the meal. Overall, it was a wonderful night, and I‚Äôd definitely come back

This restaurant is recommended on the Michelin Guide and Eater app, so I was expecting it to be pretty good. Everything was fine, but nothing was standout amazing. Service was friendly and the tres leche cake was a nice way to end the meal. I wouldn‚Äôt have a problem coming back again.
Had an incredible meal at Mission Ceviche. Luis was fantastic ‚Äî attentive, knowledgeable, and made great recommendations that really elevated the experience. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Ceviches are fresh and delicious, flavors are perfectly balanced, great delight. Food presentation is outstanding. Outside patio is comfortable, covered by awnings. Service is friendly but a bit slow.

OMG! this was the best peruvian ceviche I‚Äôve ever had! We ordered The ceviche tasting, and all 3 were incredibly delicious! The ingredients were so fresh and cooked so perfectly, bringing the different flavors together. Very attentive staff and very welcoming!

This Peruvian restaurant has a beautiful ambiance with plenty of seating, making it a great spot for a nice meal. The appetizers were delicious, and the desserts were definitely a highlight for me. The lomo saltado, however, was just okay‚Äînot my favorite compared to other places I‚Äôve tried. The drinks were enjoyable, and the service was super friendly and attentive, which made the experience pleasant. That said, the prices are on the higher side, so I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôd return for dinner. Their lunch special seems like a much better deal, and I‚Äôd consider coming back for that instead. Overall, a decent experience with some standout dishes but not necessarily a must-visit for me.

Sehr empfehlenswerte Location in Manhattan. Unaufdringlich freundlicher gleichwohl aufmerksamer sowie kompetenter Service. Sehr leckere Speisen. Fisch und seafood in gro√üer Auswahl und schmackhaft zubereitet. Sowohl peruanische als auch hauseigene Spezialit√§ten. Auch sehr sch√∂n serviert. Pr√§dikat: Wieder besuchen
Amazing food. Fresh, perfect amount of spice in my ceviche (I don‚Äôt do spice but somehow this really worked for me. Flavours were spot on). White chocolate mousse was to die for. Gio was great üòä

Delicious food, friendly and helpful service
We had the civiche sampler, tuna tartar, lomo saltado, and plantains- they were all so fresh! Destiny was an awesome server

Outstanding all around without the weight of a Michelin recognized restaurant (yet, it is one!).  Very kind service by Gio, delicate and ample dishes all around (do the ceviche tasting!), and very inviting, soft tropical ambiance.  Highly recommend for intimate dates, special occasions and memorable gatherings.

This is the ONE folks. If you are searching for an amazing dining experience, look no further. Whether you are a local or a tourist, your ig pics will glow, your loved one will be impressed and your tastebuds blessed!

Without a doubt this place is one of my fave restaurants for the following reasons:
1) The flavor combos totally rock my world! I waited for months during the pandemic to try this place and it lived up to the hype and then some!
2) The staff is outstanding,  every single time I come here, whether Im dolled up or I show up in more comfy clothes, I feel so welcomed.
3) The rotating menu, which evolves with the seasons but also because they listen to customers' feedback. I dont remember them having a tasting menu when I first visited, but later on I was able to try one. So i discovered new dishes! I do miss some dishes like the chaufa nigiri. I always ask for it. Please bring it back.
4) The drinks are so good! I love the Peruvian influence. It takes me back to the time my friend and I went to Peru.
5) As I write this review I am craving the food and drinks. ü§§ü§§

We had the mixed ceviche and it was absolutely delicious‚Äîsuper fresh and flavorful. The service was excellent, Franklin took great care of us and made the experience even better. Highly recommended!

Estoy pasando unos d√≠as en la ciudad y nos encontramos sin querer con este restaurante. Ya por fuera llamaba la atenci√≥n pero por dentro wow.
Nos recibieron de manera muy atenta y nos atendieron de manera mas atenta todav√≠a, Gio fue un gran camarero que nos ayud√≥ en nuestras decisiones respecto a la comida. Pero a parte de un servicio de 10, la comida ha sido espectacular. Pedimos el arroz chaufa, el ceviche cl√°sico, el tuna roll y la ensalada C√©sar. Lo mejor de todo es que no supimos elegir un favorito ya que estaban todos MUY BUENOS. Desde luego recomendar√≠a el lugar con los ojos cerrados

Always on the hunt for the best Peruvian spots, I found myself at Mission Ceviche on the Upper East Side. The vibe is cool and inviting, the service was excellent, and the food‚Äîamazing. We shared several dishes, each one authentic with a modern, creative twist. Recommend!

I am an extremely happy woman after leaving here tonight.  The 3 ceviches we had were absolutely amazing.  EVERYTHING we had was amazing.  The tres leches cake topped it all.  Luis, the bartender gave the BEST service and is SO friendly.  I will be coming back here regularly for sure!!!!

As much as believe this restaurant has really good food and creative dishes I regret to say that for three times in a row they didn‚Äôt have the very same item that I live so much. The dish isn‚Äôt the problem but it has been consistently unavailable every single time. Bad luck perhaps!

We got the Chef‚Äôs tasting menu and it was amazing, like a whole new experience thats gives you a little taste of the different flavors in the house.
1. Spicy ceviche, mix it all to taste the flavors
2. Sweet and sour ceviche which will calm down the spice getting you ready for the next, fish itself is preety blend tho
3. Shrimp tempura is as delicious it can get, wow 10/10
4. Lomo saltado has great soft and juicy steak, served with a side of rice, delicious overall
5. The ‚Äúchoclo con queso‚Äù dessert was delicious as well

Service was great and attentive, server explained well and answered all the questions we had about the menu!

Chicha morada, pilsen beer and maracuya sour were great drinks as well making this an amazing anniversary dinner.
I‚Äôm in the city for work and was very excited to see Mission Ceviche was just a few blocks from my location! The food was delicious, and the service was excellent! 10/10
Every single dish we got was delicious! My favorite was the lomo saltado. Destiny was amazing we loved every recommendation she made!!!

They hosted us for an engagement dinner party of 16 on Valentine‚Äôs Day and we could have not chosen a better place. From the ambience, the service, the food and drinks and the staff were amazing! We had such a delicious dinner and everyone was full at the end. My friend‚Äôs special night ended with a beautiful dinner here and we can‚Äôt wait to go back to eat here soon. They also have the best Maracuya Sour I‚Äôve had!!

Brandon at the bar helped make this a perfect experience. The classic ceviche on the appetizer menu was wow! So good! Flavorful, great variance of textures! ‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞ My friend had the fish sandwich and truffle fries. The sandwich was very good, fries also good, but not much truffle flavor. I decided to go traditional with the drink, Pisco Sour, made to perfection! Light, citrus, classic! Brandon hand crafted a sangria for my friend.
(*never done this on a review, however seems necessary‚Ä¶ so side-note to ladies, if you meet a decent-looking short guy named Carlos there who‚Äôs Colombian, RUN!)

This wasn‚Äôt my first time dining here ‚Äî I‚Äôve visited in 2021, 2022, and 2024, and again in 2025 at their other Manhattan location. As a Peruvian, I chose to return on July 29 to celebrate Peru‚Äôs National Day hoping to get some Peruvian flavors.  Unfortunately, this visit was a disappointment.

I started with a Pisco Sour, which was missing the essence of the cocktail ‚Äî barely any pisco, no noticeable syrup, and not enough egg white. It tasted more like lemon juice diluted with a splash of liquor and cold water. I brought it up with the staff, and while they kindly offered to remake it, the second version wasn‚Äôt much better, so I didn‚Äôt press further. At the end I noticed they didn‚Äôt include the Sour in the check‚ÄîI understand it as an apology and I appreciate the consideration.

Next came the Ceviche Carretillero, which lacked any real ceviche flavor ‚Äî it was simply a spicy sauce poured over some fish and calamari, with no brightness or freshness. But the final straw was the Maki Acevichado. I‚Äôve had it here before and enjoyed it, but this time it was unrecognizable: just a bland roll topped with mayonnaise, with none of the citrusy, punchy notes and real cream that make an acevichado special.

To make matters worse, the restaurant was uncomfortably crowded, and given how small the space is ‚Äî with no reception area ‚Äî it felt chaotic rather than festive.

It‚Äôs disheartening to see a place that once captured the spirit of Peruvian cuisine lose its authenticity. I hope my experience was an accident and they can still offer the greatness of our country.

I own several hospitality joints. So i understand how things work. And i rarely give one stars. I sat outside got a meal with several drinks. On a Sunday afternoon. I was alone had a meal and probably three drinks. And i kept seeing server and manager contemplating about giving me the check. They will give me the check before they ask me if I would like anything else. I had turn down the check and order more several times without anyone asking if at least i would like something else. Come on you guys can do better,especially with someone that is dropping almost $180 alone.  I like this place but this was the manager and outdoor server‚Äôs fault. Be more friendly. Genuinely ask if people want anything else. Instead of treating it like a machine. Hospitality is love. I live close. I always recommend the place. But they wont see me again. I am really disappointed.

We were recommended this spot.  Look the food was OK like not amazing like people are saying but decent food.   Nothing to warrant the insane prices,  the waiter when asked if we ordered too much food said no, it was way too much we had to takeaway.  I just can‚Äôt warrant a $210 price tag for lunch,  I mean I‚Äôd expect to be eating caviar at these prices.  The venue looks like a bad Midwest coffee shop stuff with fake plastic flowers and greenery from the rooftop.  Somebody needs to sack the interior designer and the person pricing dishes up.  These dishes should be max 15-18 buts they all sit at 25+ I would expect something  spectacular for that price range
